## Public Member Functions

### determineCalleeSaves() {#a6902342411e347a41b347f9c866433b1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void BPFFrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/bpf/bpfframelowering-h/#l00029">29</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/bpf/bpfframelowering-h">BPFFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/bpf/bpfframelowering-cpp/#l00030">30</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/bpf/bpfframelowering-cpp">BPFFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr() {#a322b5a995029dd715280204e4e0c526a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineBasicBlock::iterator llvm::BPFFrameLowering::eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
This method is called during prolog/epilog code insertion to eliminate call frame setup and destroy pseudo instructions (but only if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a> is using them).

It is responsible for eliminating these instructions, replacing them with concrete instructions. This method need only be implemented if using call frame setup/destroy pseudo instructions. Returns an iterator pointing to the instruction after the replaced one.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/bpf/bpfframelowering-h/#l00033">33</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/bpf/bpfframelowering-h">BPFFrameLowering.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
